MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI790363049
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Wollack
Chief Administrator: Keisha Taylor
Agency Name: CLARENCE FISCHER CENTER
Agency Address: 1020 COMMERCE DR
VASSAR, MI 48768-9589
License Status: 1st Provisional
License Expiration Date: 02/10/2024
Capacity: 30
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
1/24/2024 Face to Face Documentation received or sent;
Unannounced Visit;
Special Investigation Initiation;
Interviews
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/23/24, staff member assaulted youth by chest bumping the
youth. The youth did not sustain injuries and law enforcement was
not contacted. The staff member will not be suspended. It is
unknown what measures will be taken to keep the youth safe.
1

Investigation Interviews:
Youth A/Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on January 24, 2024. Youth A said the night of January
22, 2024, into January 23, 2024, he and peers ran away from the
facility. Youth A said Staff 1 had been called in to help look for him
and his peers and he felt Staff 1 was frustrated with him due to
being called into work. Youth A said he and peers returned to the
facility and were refusing to go to their rooms and were in the
cafeteria area “hanging out”. Youth A said he was bouncing a
basketball and “lost control” of the ball, and it hit Staff 1 in the
legs. Youth A said Staff 1 then walked over to him and “chest
bumped” him. Youth A said he was not upset with Staff 1 and did
not want her to get into trouble and the only reason he called it in
was because he thought she was going to press charges on him
for running away and he wanted to try to get her into trouble as
well. Youth A then got up and walked out of the interview, refusing
to discuss the incident further.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 24, 2024. Youth B was very hesitant to be interviewed
and was only willing to share limited information. Youth B was told
what the allegations were and asked if the “chest bump” had
occurred and he said “yes”. Youth B said he would not go into
details but said “watch the camera”. Youth B said it occurred in the
“middle of the cafeteria between 1:30 and 2am”. Youth B said he
would not discuss anything further and left the interview.
An attempt to interview Youth C was completed face-to-face
at the facility on January 24, 2024. Youth C came into the room
and said he “doesn’t talk to the state” and left.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on January
24, 2024. Staff 1 said she was called into work on January 22,
2024, due to Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C being escalated and
then running away from the facility. Staff 1 said she and other staff
were looking all over the facility grounds and town to find the
youth. Staff 1 said eventually Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
returned to the facility however refused to go to their rooms and
were in the cafeteria area. Staff 1 said Youth A was able to get
into the gym and get a basketball and was playing with it in the
cafeteria. Staff 1 said she had her back to him and felt the ball hit
her in the legs. Staff 1 said she walked over to Youth A and she
stood next to him with their shoulders touching and told him he
needed to “knock it off” and not throw the ball at her. Staff 1 said
this was not done in an aggressive manner but rather a supportive
attempt to get him to make better choices. Staff 1 said Youth A
2

never said that interaction hurt him in anyway or that he was upset
by her actions. Staff 1 said at no point did she talk to Youth A
about pressing charges on him.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on January
24, 2024. Staff 2 said she was called into work on January 22,
2024, due to Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C running around the
campus and she was asked to search buildings and ensure all
empty buildings were secure. Staff 2 said eventually Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C returned to Clarence Fischer Center and
were refusing to follow directions and would not leave the
cafeteria. Staff 2 said Youth A had a basketball he was messing
around with throughout the time the youth were in the cafeteria.
Staff 2 said she never saw the basketball hit Staff 1 and never
saw Staff 1 “chest bump” into Youth A. Staff 2 said did not stay in
the cafeteria throughout the entire incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on January
24, 2024. Staff 3 said she saw a group text message regarding
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C AWOLing from the facility so she
came into work to help search for the youth the night of January
22, 2024. Staff 3 said eventually Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
returned to Clarence Fischer Center however refused to go to
their rooms for bedtime and stayed in the cafeteria most of the
night. Staff 3 said Youth A had a basketball and was being
careless and lost control while playing with it and it hit Staff 1.
Staff 3 said Staff 1 walked over to Youth A and stood next to him
and told him to “stop messing around and not hurt her”. Staff 3
said Youth A responded that he did not try to hurt her but if he
wanted to “what was [Staff 1] going to do about it”. Staff 3 said
Staff 1 was standing next to Youth A for a few seconds and it was
not an aggressive manner but rather just a supportive approach to
get Youth A to stop what he was doing. Staff 3 said she never saw
Staff 1 being physically aggressive towards Youth A.
Video Review:
Video footage of January 23, 2024, Clarence Fischer Center
cafeteria, was reviewed on January 24, 2024. The video shows
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C in the cafeteria and Youth A
playing with a basketball. Youth A loses control of the basketball,
and it goes across the room and hits Staff 1 in the legs. Staff 1 is
seen walking over to Youth A and standing next to him with their
shoulders touching and her arm across the middle of his back
near his waistline. Staff 1’s approach to Youth A was not
aggressive or forceful. Staff 1 looked at Youth A and her mouth
was moving. Staff 1 and Youth A were in this position for a few
3

seconds and Youth A moved away and Staff 1 did not stop him or
approach him after that. Staff 1 was not seen bumping her chest
into Youth A’s chest.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with intervention standards and
prohibitions. There is no evidence that Staff 1 assaulted Youth A
by chest bumping him or in any other manner.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
